title: ‘As Long as It Takes’: Biden Adds to Talk of a New Cold War
description: But that oversimplifies a complex global situation, others say, with a weakened Russia and with China facing serious problems of its own.

title: Russian General Ivan Popov Denounces Military Leadership Amid Turmoil
description: The Wagner group mutiny three weeks ago has exposed dissension and fueled a shake-up in the Russian military, as it tries to fend off a Ukrainian advance.

title: Aspartame is Possibly Linked to Cancer in Humans, the WHO Says
description: The F.D.A. and the powerful beverage industry protested the new findings, and a second W.H.O. group stood by its standard that the sweetener is generally safe.

title: Republicans Assail Kerry Before His Climate Talks With China
description: John Kerry, President Biden’s climate envoy, was criticized by Republicans as being too soft on China, the world’s biggest polluter.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Thailand in Turmoil
description: Also, an industry-wide strike in Hollywood, floods in Delhi and Netflix’s Asia strategy.

title: Biden Says the U.S. Is Open to a Prisoner Swap to Free Evan Gershkovich
description: The president confirmed that a ‘process is underway’ during a news conference in Finland.

title: BBC’s Coverage of Huw Edwards’s Behavior Raises Questions of Its Own
description: The BBC is no ordinary media outlet and its presenter is no ordinary journalist. But the network’s wall-to-wall coverage has raised questions of its own.

title: Burger King Thailand’s ‘Real Cheeseburger’: All Cheese, No Meat
description: The latest fast-food stunt to sweep the internet is the “Real Cheeseburger” from Burger King Thailand, 20 slices of American cheese on a bun with no sauce or meat.

title: Burger King Thailand’s ‘Real Cheeseburger’: All Cheese, No Meat
description: The latest fast-food stunt to sweep the internet is the “Real Cheeseburger” from Burger King Thailand, 20 slices of American cheese on a bun with no sauce or meat.

title: Surviving Extreme Heat
description: A dispatch from Phoenix.

title: ‘They’re Outsmarting Us’: Birds Build Nests from Anti-Bird Spikes
description: Strips of sharp metal pins are meant to keep birds away from buildings. Some birds are stealing them to build their nests.

title: Mass Grave With Dozens of Bodies Uncovered in Sudan, U.N. Says
description: As war rages in Sudan, the United Nations said the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces and its allies were responsible for killing at least 87 people in the western region of Darfur.

title: Biden Vows to Defend ‘Every Inch’ of NATO Alliance in Finland
description: In Finland, the president depicted the current moment as “an inflection point” in which decisions made now would “determine the course of history.”

title: Blinken Meets China’s Top Diplomat in Latest Bid to Ease Tensions
description: In their second meeting in less than a month, the secretary of state spoke to China’s envoy, Wang Yi, about ‘managing competition’ amid reports of a potential Chinese hack.

title: Leaks Can Make Natural Gas as Bad as Coal for Climate, Study Says
description: The findings cast doubt on the idea that natural gas can serve as a transitional fuel to a future powered entirely by renewables like solar and wind.

title: Biden meets with Nordic leaders after progress on Sweden’s bid to join NATO.
Bucha gets a remake, but pain lingers behind the facade.
Zelensky Returns From NATO Summit With Mixed Results
description: The Ukrainian leader secured new pledges of weapons and reaffirmed security commitments from powerful Western allies, but it was not clear how significant a boost they could provide for his country’s counteroffensive.

title: Thailand Parliament Vote: Pita Limjaroenrat Faces Setbacks
description: The Thai military’s hold on the Senate blocked a popular progressive candidate who had emerged as the clear winner. Parliament will now have to vote again, as the opposition vows to demonstrate.

title: Red Fort Floods in Delhi as Evacuations Are Ordered
description: The authorities warned of widespread flooding in the Indian capital after days of torrential rains claimed dozens of lives in neighboring states.

title: Biden Pledges Long-Term Backing for Ukraine, but a U.S. Election Looms
description: Citing American politics, some NATO leaders expressed concern that Washington could waver in its support if there were a shift in power.

title: Compounding Disasters
description: America’s compounding natural disasters show the reality of climate change.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Launches Drones at Kyiv, Leaving One Person Dead
description: Hours after the NATO summit ended, the Ukrainian capital was targeted with drones for the third night in a row.

title: UK Defense Minister Ben Wallace Says Ukraine Should Show More Gratitude
Thailand Parliament Vote: Pita Limjaroenrat Faces Setbacks
description: Pita Limjaroenrat, a progressive who led his party to victory in May, was hit by two setbacks on the eve of the vote for prime minister.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Outcomes from a NATO summit.

title: Guatemala’s Top Party Is Suspended, Putting Election Into Turmoil
description: The move threatens the presidential bid of Bernardo Arévalo, an anticorruption candidate who made a surprisingly strong showing in the initial voting, propelling him into a runoff.

title: Looming U.S. Investment Restrictions on China Threaten Diplomatic Outreach
description: Any such restrictions are expected to anger Beijing and will be the first test of the new channels of communication that the world’s two largest economies are trying to restore.
